info.title: Azure Maps Data Registry Service
info.description: APIs for managing data registry in Azure Maps.

AADToken.description:
These are the [Azure Active Directory OAuth2](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/v1-overview) Flows. When paired with [Azure role-based access](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/overview) control it can be used to control access to Azure Maps REST APIs. Azure role-based access controls are used to designate access to one or more Azure Maps resource account or sub-resources. Any user, group, or service principal can be granted access via a  built-in role or a custom role composed of one or more permissions to Azure Maps REST APIs.

To implement scenarios, we recommend viewing [authentication concepts](https://aka.ms/amauth). In summary, this security definition provides a solution for modeling application(s) via objects capable of access control on specific APIs and scopes.

#### Notes
* This security definition **requires** the use of the `x-ms-client-id` header to indicate which Azure Maps resource the application is requesting access to. This can be acquired from the [Maps management API](https://aka.ms/amauthdetails).
* 
The `Authorization URL` is specific to the Azure public cloud instance. Sovereign clouds have unique Authorization URLs and Azure Active directory configurations. 
* 
The Azure role-based access control is configured from the [Azure management plane](https://aka.ms/amrbac) via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.
* 
Usage of the [Azure Maps Web SDK](https://aka.ms/amaadmc) allows for configuration based setup of an application for multiple use cases.
* Currently, Azure Active Directory [v1.0 or v2.0](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/azure-ad-endpoint-comparison) supports Work, School, and Guests but does not support Personal accounts.

AzureKey.description:
This is a shared key that is provisioned when creating an [Azure Maps resource](https://aka.ms/amauth) through the Azure management plane  via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.

 With this key, any application is authorized to access  all REST APIs. In other words, these can currently be treated as master keys to the account which they are issued for.

 For publicly exposed applications, our recommendation is to use server-to-server access of Azure Maps REST APIs where this key can be  securely stored.
AzureKey.name: subscription-key

SasToken.description:
This is a shared access signature token is created from the List SAS operation on the [Azure Maps resource](https://aka.ms/amauth) through the Azure management plane via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.

 With this token, any application is authorized to access with Azure role-based access controls and fine-grain control to the expiration, rate, and region(s) of use for the particular token. In other words, the SAS Token can be used to allow applications to control access in a more secured way than the shared key.

 For publicly exposed applications, our recommendation is to configure a specific list of allowed origins on the [Map account resource](https://aka.ms/amauth) to limit rendering abuse and regularly renew the SAS Token.
SasToken.name: SAS Token

ApiVersion.name: api-version
ApiVersion.description: Version number of Azure Maps API.

UserDataId.name: udid
UserDataId.description: The user data id of the data registry. The `udid` must have been obtained from a successful long-running [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register) call, in GUID format.

OperationIdHeader.name: Operation-Id
OperationIdHeader.description: The caller provided operationId, in GUID format.

OperationIdQuery.name: operationId
OperationIdQuery.description: The ID to query the status for the data register request.

values.description: Delete the data registry without deleting the underlying content stored in customer's storage account.
Delete the data registry as well as the underlying content stored in customer's storage account.

get.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

This API allows the caller to fetch the list of all data registries registered previously using the [Register or Replace API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register-or-replace).

This API won't check whether Azure Maps can access the underlying content and whether integrity check is passed for each data registry. Please use [Get Data Registry API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/get-data-registry) for the latest status individually.

## Submit List Request

To list all your map data content you will issue a `GET` request with no additional parameters.

## List Response

The Data Registry List API returns the complete list of all data registries in `json` format.

200.description: The request completed successfully. The response body contains a list of all the previously registered data registries.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

get.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

This API allows the caller to fetch the data registry of a given udid registered previously using the [Register or Replace API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register-or-replace). If Azure Maps cannot access the underlying content or integrity check is not passed, `status` will be `Failed` and error detail is returned.

## Submit Get Data Registry Request

To fetch the data registry of a given udid you will issue a `GET` request with no additional parameters.

200.description: The request completed successfully. The response body is the data registry of a given udid.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

put.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

The Data Registry Register API allows the caller to register their data content uploaded to Azure Storage Account in the Azure Maps Service with customer provided udid, restricted in GUID format; or to replace an existing udid with another data registry.

You can use this API in scenarios like registering a collection of Geofences in `GeoJSON` format for use in [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/spatial), or registering a set of DWG design files as a zipped [Drawing Package](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-maps/drawing-requirements) for use in [Azure Maps Creator Conversion Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/v2/conversion).

## Submit Register or Replace Request

To register or replace your data registry you will use a `PUT` request. The request body will contain the connection object.

For example, to register a collection of geofences  in `GeoJSON` format, set connection object representing how Azure Maps can access your geojson file. and `dataFormat` to _geojson_ in the request body.

The Data Registry Register or Replace API performs a [long-running request](https://aka.ms/am-creator-lrt-v2).

parameters.name: dataRegistry
parameters.description: The data registry to be registered.

200.description: Resource replacing: The request has been accepted for processing. Please use the URL in the Operation-Location Header to obtain status.

Operation-Id.description: ID of the status monitor for the operation.

Operation-Location.description: New URL to check for the results of the long running process. `api-version` is not included in the URL.

201.description: Resource creating: The request has been accepted for processing. Please use the URL in the Operation-Location Header to obtain status.

Operation-Id.description: ID of the status monitor for the operation.

Operation-Location.description: New URL to check for the results of the long running process. `api-version` is not included in the URL.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

patch.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

The Data Registry Update API allows the caller to update a previously registered data registry.

You can use this API in a scenario like adding or removing geofences to or from an existing collection of geofences. Geofences are registered using the [Register or Replace API](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register-or-replace), for use in the [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/spatial).

This API is a synchronous API but may eventually transition into `Failed` state even if the API returns `200 OK`. You can use [Get Data Registry API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/get-data-registry) to get the updated status.

## Submit Patch Request

To update a data registry you will use a `PATCH` request. The request body will contain an object representing a patch to the data registry, in [JSON Merge Patch (RFC7396)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7396). The path will contain the `udid` of the data registry to be update.

For example, to just change the connection object of a data registry that were previously registered without changing other properties of the data registry, set the `udid` in the query parameter and the new connection object in the body.

parameters.name: dataRegistryPatch
parameters.description: The object for updating a given data registry

200.description: Resource updating: It is still possible that the data registry eventually transitions to `Failed` state. Please check [DataRegistry Get API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/get) for the updated status

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

delete.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

This API allows the caller to unregister a previously registered data registry. Default is to unregister the data registry without deleting the underlying content in caller's storage account but you can specify `deleteMode=hard` in query parameter to make it delete the underlying content (requires MSI to hold proper permission to the storage account).

You can use this API in a scenario like unregistering geofences previously registered using the [Register or Replace API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register-or-replace) for use in our [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/spatial), or unregistering a zipped DWG design files which was used in [Azure Maps Creator Conversion Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/v2/conversion).

## Submit Unregister Request

To unregister a data registry you will issue a `DELETE` request where the path will contain the `udid` of the data registry to unregister.

For example, to unregister a collection of geofences previously registered, set the `udid` in the query parameter. Specify `deleteMode=hard` in query parameter if you want to also delete the content of the collection of geofences.

## Unregister Response

The Data Delete API returns a HTTP `204 No Content` response with an empty body, no matter it has been unregistered successfully or is not found.

204.description: Data registry unregister request completed successfully. The data registry was unregistered in Azure Maps Service.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

get.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

This API allows the caller to retrieve the underlying content of a previously registered data registry after data integrity check. The content is not available if the status is `Running` or `Failed`.

You can use this API in a scenario like downloading an existing collection of geofences registered previously using the [Register or Replace API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register-or-replace).

## Submit Get Content Request

To get the underlying content of a udid you will use a `GET` request where the path will contain the `udid` of the content to retrieve.

## Get Content Response

The Get Content API will return a HTTP `200 OK` response if the underlying content with the passed-in `udid` is ready (`Completed` status), where the response body will be the underlying content. A HTTP `400 Bad Request` error response will be returned if the `udid` is not ready (`Running` status) or broken (`Failed` status).

200.description: Get content request completed successfully. The response body will contain the content for the passed in `udid`.

Content-Type.description: The content-type for the Download API response.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

get.description:
The endpoint of Data Registry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Data Registry Service is not available for global maps account.

This path will be obtained from a call to [Register or Replace API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register-or-replace). While in progress, a HTTP `200 OK` response will be returned with `Retry-After` header - followed by a HTTP `200 OK` with no extra header once completed.

200.description: The status of the long running operation

Retry-After.description: Recommended minimum number of seconds to wait before next check.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

DataRegistry.description: The data registry in Azure Maps.

udid.description: The user data id for the data registry.

description.description: The description of the data registry.

downloadURL.description: The download URL of the underlying data. It may not be available if the status of the data registry is `Running` or `Failed`. Note that `api-version` is not included.

sizeInBytes.description: The size of the content in bytes.

contentMD5.description: The content MD5 of the content.

DataRegistryPatch.description: An object for patching a given data registry.

description.description: The description to be given to the data registry. The max length is 1024 characters.

Connection.description: A Connection object representing how Azure Maps Service accesses customer's resources and the scope of it.

msiClientId.description: ClientId of MSI. Use system assigned identity if not provided.

linkedResource.description: The linked resource. Need to configure in control plane beforehand. Default is `default-linked-resource`

ConnectionPatch.description: A ConnectionPatch object represents a patch to a Connection object, in [JSON Merge Patch (RFC7396)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7396).

msiClientId.description: ClientId of MSI. Use system assigned identity if not provided.

linkedResource.description: The linked resource. Need to configure in control plane first.

ConnectionScope.description: The scope within the specified linked resource Azure Maps Service can access.

containerName.description: The container name where the blob file is stored. Required when type is `AzureBlobFile`.

blobPath.description: The path to the blob file. Required when type is `AzureBlobFile`.

DataRegistryList.description: The response model for the DataRegistry List API. Returns a list of all the previously registered data.

dataRegistries.description: A list of all the previously registered data registries.

DataFormat.description: Data format of the uploaded content for validation purpose.

values.description: [GeoJSON](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946) is a JSON based geospatial data interchange format.

LongRunningOperationResult.description: The response model for a Long-Running Operations API.

LongRunningOperationStatus.description: The status of a long running operation.

values.description: The request has one or more failures.
